name: Driver Type Classification
description: Classification of driver mechanisms used to apply torque in screw fastening, distinguishing between manual, continuous mechanical, impact-based, and axial hammer drivers.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Manual Driver
hasDefinedTerm.description: Applies torque by hand without powered assistance, typically used where control and precision are required.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Mechanical Driver
hasDefinedTerm.description: Delivers continuous rotational torque via electric or pneumatic motor, suitable for general fastening.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Impact Driver
hasDefinedTerm.description: Applies torque through repeated internal hammer impacts, used for driving into denser or resistant material.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Rotary Hammer / Hammer Drill
hasDefinedTerm.description: Applies axial hammering force while rotating, used primarily for drilling concrete, masonry, and stone.
